title: Links for March
summary:
Key ideas:
- US government considered using pyrotechnics to fake the Second Coming
- Blind taste test shows experts cannot tell difference between prestigious and less prestigious coffee brands
- First female mayor in Afghanistan is proving critics wrong
- Study shows that rightists are more likely to buy name brand, while leftists are more likely to buy generic
- Google Reader, Zeo, and InTrade are all shutting down

Key learnings:
- The Church is larger than ever, despite narrative of Catholic decline
- Happiness has been increasing over the past sixty years in most first world countries
- Leftist and rightists' political ideologies may have mental underpinnings

Key questions:
- Can humans evolve quickly enough to adapt to dietary changes associated with civilization?
- What is the difference between hunter-gatherer’s clogged arteries and ours?
- Will the closing of China's forced labor camps see an improvement in human rights?
